Name: The Burly French Man
Ingredients: 20 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
Instructions: RINSE chilled glass with absinthe and set to one side. STIR other ingredients with ice and strain into absinthe rinsed glass.
Review: Boozy and served Sazerac-style, cognac with powerful Chartreuse herbal notes and faintly jammy fruit.
History: Created in 2015 by Tommy Long at the Groucho Club in London, England. Originally made with Cocchi Storico Vermouth di Torino rosso vermouth.
Nutrition: One serving of The Burly French Man contains 266 calories
